intro: Leandra eichleri, commonly known as the Eichler's leandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of tropical flora.
